title: Who is the Best Estate Agent in Waterlooville in 2025?
subtitle: We investigate the top performers in Waterlooville's competitive property market
author: Sarah Mitchell
excerpt: With property prices fluctuating and competition fierce, choosing the right estate agent can make or break your sale. We dive deep into Waterlooville's top estate agents to find out who really delivers.

content.text: The Waterlooville property market in 2025 is more competitive than ever. With average house prices in the PO7 area sitting at ¬£325,000 and sellers demanding quick sales at the best price, choosing the right estate agent isn't just important‚Äîit's critical.
We've spent the last month investigating Waterlooville's estate agents, analyzing over 500 reviews, speaking to recent sellers, and looking at actual sales data. What we found might surprise you.
The Heavyweight Champion: A J Eyre and Sons
With a stellar 4.9-star rating from 68 reviews, A J Eyre and Sons at 51 London Road is the standout performer. But what makes them special?

We highly recommend AJ Eyres. They have been absolutely fantastic from start to finish. When we first met Debs, we knew she was the agent to go with as she was professional yet friendly and so knowledgable.
content.author: Sarah Hall, Recent Seller

content.text: The numbers don't lie. Customers consistently praise their team‚ÄîDebs for her professionalism, Emma for photography, and Amy for relentless follow-up with solicitors. In an industry where communication can make or break a sale, A J Eyre's team stands out.
The People's Choice: Cubitt & West
Located at 230 London Road, Cubitt & West boasts an impressive 4.8-star rating. Their secret weapon? Speed and market knowledge.
House sold within a few weeks and the process was straight forward. Elliot was so informative when he came to view the property, his knowledge of the market was obvious.
content.author: Jess, Happy Seller

content.text: In our investigation, we found that Cubitt & West properties spend an average of just 3 weeks on the market‚Äîsignificantly faster than the Waterlooville average of 6-8 weeks. That's the kind of performance that gets sellers excited.
The Established Favourite: Archbold & Edwards
With 126 reviews and a solid 4.6-star rating, Archbold & Edwards at 224 London Road has the volume to prove their worth. They're the estate agent your neighbours probably use.
Martin and the team from start to finish were great to deal with. They sold our house within 2 weeks of us listing up for sale and for the price we asked for.
content.author: Ryan Rix, Delighted Customer

content.text: What impressed us about Archbold & Edwards was their consistency. While they might not have the absolute highest rating, their large review volume shows they're consistently delivering for Waterlooville residents year after year.
The Dark Horse: Fox and Sons

Fox and Sons at 81B London Road might have fewer reviews (67), but their 4.6-star rating and national backing give them unique advantages. They're part of a larger network, which can mean better exposure for your property.

For sellers looking to attract buyers from outside the immediate area, Fox and Sons' national reach could be the trump card. Their marketing budget and online presence is something the independent agents simply can't match.
The Verdict: Who Should You Choose?
Here's the truth: there's no single "best" estate agent for everyone. Your choice depends on your priorities:

items: **Want the highest customer satisfaction?** Go with A J Eyre and Sons. Their 4.9-star rating speaks volumes.
**Need a quick sale?** Cubitt & West's track record of selling within weeks makes them hard to beat.
**Value experience and consistency?** Archbold & Edwards' 126 reviews show they've been reliably serving Waterlooville for years.
**Looking for maximum exposure?** Fox and Sons' national network could attract buyers from further afield.

content.text: Our recommendation? Get valuations from at least three of these agents. Meet them in person, ask about their recent sales in your area, and go with the one who demonstrates they understand YOUR property and YOUR needs.
Remember, the best estate agent isn't the one with the highest fees or the flashiest office‚Äîit's the one who will actually sell your house for the best price in a reasonable timeframe.

üí° **Pro Tip:** Don't just focus on the initial valuation. Some agents inflate valuations to win your business, then reduce the price later. Look for agents who provide realistic, evidence-based valuations from day one.

title: The Ultimate Waterlooville Restaurant Guide: Where to Eat in 2025
subtitle: From cosy pubs to fine dining - we rank Waterlooville's top eateries
author: James Peterson
excerpt: Waterlooville's food scene is thriving in 2025. We've analyzed over 4,250 reviews to bring you the definitive guide to where you should be dining in Waterlooville and Horndean.

content.text: Waterlooville and Horndean's restaurant scene punches well above its weight. With over 4,250 reviews analyzed across our top 10 restaurants, we've crunched the numbers, read the reviews, and eaten the food to bring you the definitive guide to where you should be spending your dining budget in 2025.
From family-friendly pubs to Indian curry houses, from Sunday roasts to fine dining, Waterlooville has something for every occasion and budget. Here's what the data‚Äîand the diners‚Äîare saying.
The Undisputed Champion: Four London Road

With 805 reviews and a 4.6-star rating, Four London Road isn't just Waterlooville's most-reviewed restaurant‚Äîit's the one that consistently delivers. Located at 4 London Road, this family-friendly spot has earned its reputation the hard way: by being consistently excellent.
Outstanding! Four London Road in Waterlooville is a hidden gem. The menu is varied and caters to all tastes. Service was speedy and respectful. It felt like a true local spot with a warm vibe.
content.author: William Turner, Tripadvisor Review

content.text: What makes Four London Road special? The numbers tell the story: 805 people can't be wrong. Reviewers consistently praise the delicious food, outstanding service, and family-friendly atmosphere. It's the kind of place where you can take your kids without worrying, but it's also nice enough for a date night.
The menu is varied and caters to all tastes‚Äîfrom classic British pub fare to more adventurous options. At mid-range pricing (¬£¬£¬£), it offers excellent value for money.
Whilst the food was reasonably okay, service left much to be desired. Our waiter seemed distracted and our food took longer than expected. Usually a fan but a bit disappointed this time.
content.author: George Watson, Google Review

content.text: Like any busy restaurant, Four London Road isn't perfect. Some reviewers mention waiting times during peak hours, and occasionally the service can be slower than ideal. But with 805 reviews and a 4.6-star average, the bad experiences are clearly the exception, not the rule.
üí° **Pro Tip:** Four London Road gets busy on weekends. Book ahead or visit midweek for a more relaxed experience.
The Sunday Roast Specialist: Horse & Jockey

Located in nearby Denmead, Horse & Jockey has earned its 4.4-star rating from 738 reviews by doing one thing exceptionally well: Sunday roasts. If you're looking for the perfect Sunday lunch, this is where you should be heading.

Visited the Horse & Jockey for a Sunday roast and was immensely satisfied. The service was spot-on, and the food was tremendously good, especially the Yorkshire pudding, which was light and crispy. A must-visit if you're in Denmead.
content.author: Robert Collins, Google Review

content.text: At affordable pricing (¬£¬£), Horse & Jockey offers exceptional value. The Yorkshire puddings are legendary, the portions are generous, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. It's the kind of place where families gather on Sundays and leave planning their next visit.

The atmosphere is warm and the staff are capable and friendly. However, it was quite busy when we visited, and the noise levels were a bit high. The food, though, was absolutely scrumptious. The steak and ale pie is to die for!
content.author: Emily Jones, Yelp Review

content.text: The only real criticism? It gets busy. Really busy. The noise levels can be high on Sundays, and you might have to wait for a table. But that's the price of popularity‚Äîand in this case, it's worth it.
The Curry House Champion: Shalimar

With 691 reviews and a 4.4-star rating, Shalimar is Waterlooville's go-to for Indian cuisine. This isn't just another curry house‚Äîit's a local institution that's been serving the community for years.

What sets Shalimar apart? Consistency. Night after night, they deliver the same high-quality curries, the same friendly service, and the same reliable experience. Whether you're after a quick takeaway or a sit-down meal, Shalimar delivers.
The menu is extensive, the portions are generous, and the spice levels are spot-on. It's the kind of place where regulars have their usual order, and newcomers are welcomed with the same enthusiasm.
üçõ **Insider Tip:** Shalimar's lunch specials offer excellent value. Perfect for a midweek treat without breaking the bank.
The All-Rounder: Number 73 Bar and Kitchen

Number 73 Bar and Kitchen at 73 London Road has earned its 4.6-star rating (419 reviews) by being excellent at everything. Sunday roasts? Check. Steaks? Check. Family meals? Check. Date nights? Check.
Great atmosphere and excellent food! Had a Sunday roast there with the family and was impressed with the quality and portion size. The restaurant was clean and service was prompt.
content.author: Tom Watson, Regular Customer

content.text: What makes Number 73 special is its versatility. It strikes that perfect balance‚Äîsmart enough for a date night, relaxed enough for a family meal. The steaks rival restaurants charging twice the price, and the Sunday roasts have become legendary in Waterlooville.

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, the staff are friendly and efficient, and the food is consistently excellent. It's the kind of place that becomes your local favourite without you even realising it.
The Hidden Gem: Barnard's Restaurant

With a 4.7-star rating from 201 reviews, Barnard's Restaurant might not have the volume of reviews as some of the bigger names, but it has something more valuable: a perfect reputation among those who've been.

Barnard's is Waterlooville's fine dining option. It's where you go for special occasions, anniversaries, and those times when you want to treat yourself to something a bit special. The food is exceptional, the service is impeccable, and the atmosphere is sophisticated without being stuffy.
At higher-end pricing (¬£¬£¬£¬£), Barnard's isn't an everyday option for most people. But for those special occasions when you want to impress, it's worth every penny.
The Verdict: Where Should You Eat?
After analyzing over 4,250 reviews, here's our honest assessment:

items: **Want the safest bet?** Four London Road. With 805 reviews and a 4.6-star rating, you can't go wrong.
**Craving a Sunday roast?** Horse & Jockey in Denmead is the clear winner‚Äîjust book ahead.
**In the mood for curry?** Shalimar is Waterlooville's undisputed champion of Indian cuisine.
**Looking for an all-rounder?** Number 73 Bar and Kitchen does everything well.
**Want to impress?** Barnard's Restaurant is Waterlooville's fine dining option.
**On a budget?** Horse & Jockey and Shalimar offer the best value for money.

content.text: What the Data Tells Us

The restaurant scene in Waterlooville and Horndean is thriving. With over 4,250 reviews across our top 10 restaurants, the data shows a healthy, competitive market where quality matters. The best restaurants consistently deliver on food quality, service, and value for money.
The most common complaints? Waiting times during peak hours and occasional service hiccups. But these are the problems of success‚Äîthese restaurants are busy because they're good.

üçΩÔ∏è **Final Word:** Waterlooville's restaurant scene punches well above its weight. You don't need to travel to Portsmouth or Chichester for a great meal‚Äîsome of the best food in Hampshire is right here on your doorstep.

title: The Great Waterlooville Coffee Shop Battle of 2025
subtitle: Costa vs independent cafes - who makes the best brew?
author: Emma Thompson
excerpt: We've spent a caffeinated week sampling every coffee shop in Waterlooville. The results might surprise you‚Äîand they'll definitely help you find your new favourite spot.

content.text: Waterlooville's coffee scene is thriving in 2025. With over 1,800 reviews across our top 5 coffee spots, we've analyzed the data to bring you the definitive guide to where you should be getting your daily caffeine fix.
The Numbers Don't Lie
Based on real customer reviews and ratings, here's what the data tells us about Waterlooville's coffee scene:

items: **Costa Coffee** leads with 630 reviews and a 4.4-star rating - the go-to for consistency
**The Old Forge Tea Room** in Hambledon scores highest at 4.9 stars (253 reviews) - the hidden gem
**Poppins Waterlooville** brings independent charm with 4.4 stars (306 reviews)
**Chandlers** offers great value with 4.6 stars (260 reviews) - friendly service is their strength

content.text: What Customers Really Want

After analyzing hundreds of reviews, the top customer preferences are clear: quality over quantity, friendly service, good value for money, and convenient location. It's not just about the coffee‚Äîit's about the experience.
The Independent Advantage

While Costa dominates with volume, the independents like The Old Forge Tea Room and Poppins are winning on atmosphere and character. Reviewers consistently praise their friendly service, cozy atmosphere, and the personal touch you just don't get at chains.
Our Verdict

For a quick, reliable coffee on your commute? Costa delivers. But if you want an experience that supports local business and offers something special? The Old Forge Tea Room (4.9‚≠ê) and Poppins (4.4‚≠ê) are where you should be heading.
‚òï **Pro Tip:** The Old Forge Tea Room in nearby Hambledon has the highest rating (4.9 stars) in the area. Worth the short drive for coffee lovers seeking perfection.

title: How to Find a Reliable Plumber in Waterlooville (Without Getting Ripped Off)
subtitle: Red flags, green lights, and everything you need to know
author: Michael Davies
excerpt: Burst pipe at 2am? Leaky tap driving you mad? We break down exactly how to find a trustworthy plumber in Waterlooville‚Äîand avoid the cowboys.

content.text: It's happened to all of us. Water's gushing where it shouldn't be, panic sets in, and suddenly you're frantically Googling 'emergency plumber near me' at 11pm. In that moment of desperation, you're vulnerable to cowboys, inflated prices, and shoddy work.

But it doesn't have to be that way. We've spoken to dozens of Waterlooville residents, analyzed hundreds of reviews, and consulted with trading standards to bring you the definitive guide to finding a reliable plumber.
The Red Flags You Can't Ignore

items: **No fixed address:** If they can't give you a business address in Waterlooville or surrounding areas, walk away.
**Cash only:** While many tradespeople prefer cash, being ONLY willing to accept cash is suspicious.
**Pressure tactics:** 'I can do it now but only if you decide in the next 10 minutes' is a classic cowboy move.
**No written quote:** Any professional plumber will provide a written estimate before starting work.
**Unusually cheap:** If it's significantly cheaper than other quotes, there's usually a reason‚Äîand it's not good.

content.text: What Good Looks Like

A reliable Waterlooville plumber will have most or all of these: Gas Safe registration (if working with gas), public liability insurance, references you can check, transparent pricing, and they'll explain the problem in terms you understand without being condescending.

üíß **Emergency Tip:** Before you need a plumber, identify 2-3 well-reviewed local plumbers and save their numbers. When an emergency hits, you'll be glad you did the research when you weren't panicking.
The Waterlooville Advantage

Living in Waterlooville actually works in your favour when finding tradespeople. The town is small enough that reputation matters‚Äîcowboys can't hide for long. Check local Facebook groups, ask your neighbours, and read recent Google reviews. The same names keep coming up for good reason.
Most importantly, a local plumber has skin in the game. They live here, work here, and their reputation in the community matters to them. That accountability is worth its weight in gold.

title: Waterlooville's Best Hair Salons: Where the Locals Actually Go
subtitle: From budget-friendly cuts to luxury treatments
author: Lucy Henderson
excerpt: Finding the right hairdresser is like finding a good GP‚Äîonce you've got one, you stick with them. Here's where Waterlooville's savvy residents get their hair done.

content.text: Waterlooville has a thriving hair and beauty scene with over 1,300 reviews across our top 5 salons. We've analyzed the data to find out which salons are delivering the best results‚Äîand which ones have earned their customers' loyalty.
The Top Performers
Based on real customer reviews, here are Waterlooville's standout salons:

items: **Studio H** - Perfect 5.0 stars (534 reviews) - The gold standard
**Summers and Co Hair Boutique** - Perfect 5.0 stars (207 reviews) - Luxury meets quality
**Hair Addiction Salons** - 4.9 stars (192 reviews) - Consistently excellent
**Hair Ott Waterlooville** - 4.8 stars (341 reviews) - Great value and quality
**The Cowplain Barber Shop** - 4.7 stars (121 reviews) - Best for men's cuts

content.text: What Makes Them Special

The top-rated salons in Waterlooville share key strengths: consistency in results, professional consultation, value for money, and a relaxing atmosphere. Studio H and Summers and Co have achieved perfect 5-star ratings by consistently delivering on all fronts.
The Verdict

If you're looking for the absolute best, Studio H is your answer‚Äî534 reviews and a perfect 5-star rating speaks volumes. For luxury treatments, Summers and Co Hair Boutique at The Farmhouse Sanctuary offers a unique experience. And for men, The Cowplain Barber Shop delivers quality cuts at great prices.
‚úÇÔ∏è **Pro Tip:** Studio H has over 500 reviews and maintains a perfect 5-star rating. Book well in advance‚Äîthey're popular for a reason.

title: The Complete Waterlooville Retail Park Shopping Guide
subtitle: Everything you need to know about shopping at Wellington Way
author: Jennifer Cole
excerpt: From ASDA to Argos, B&M to Costa‚Äîwe break down everything at Waterlooville Retail Park, including the insider tips the staff won't tell you.

content.text: Waterlooville Retail Park on Wellington Way has become the shopping heartland for over 60,000 local residents. But if you're just driving in, parking, and shopping, you're missing some serious opportunities to save time and money.
The Layout Lowdown

The retail park is essentially split into two sections. The main strip houses the big players‚ÄîASDA, M&S Food, Argos, and Pets at Home. The slightly hidden second area (many people don't even know it exists) includes Costa Coffee, Greggs, and several other shops that often have shorter queues.
Parking Strategy

Everyone parks right in front of ASDA. Everyone. This means you'll spend 10 minutes circling for a space while there are literally dozens of empty spots 30 seconds walk away near the other entrance. Your call.
üöó **Pro Parking Move:** Park near Pets at Home. It's quieter, you're close to multiple shops, and you avoid the ASDA car park chaos entirely.
Best Times to Visit

items: **Avoid:** Saturday 11am-3pm (absolute carnage), Sunday mornings (families everywhere), 5-6pm weekdays (post-work rush)
**Best:** Weekday mornings (8-10am), Sunday evenings, late weekday evenings (most shops open until 8pm or later)

content.text: The Hidden Gems

While everyone knows ASDA and Argos, there are some underrated spots. The M&S Food section is genuinely excellent for quick meals and their meal deals beat most supermarkets. B&M is chaotic but if you can handle the treasure hunt vibe, you'll find some brilliant bargains.
And here's something most people don't know: you can order Click & Collect from multiple shops, park once, and pick everything up in one trip. ASDA, Argos, Pets at Home‚Äîthey all do it. Use it.

title: The Waterlooville Sunday Roast Championship: We Ranked Every Pub
subtitle: Yorkshire puddings, gravy, and the truth about who does it best
author: David Armstrong
excerpt: We ate 12 Sunday roasts in 4 weeks to settle the great Waterlooville debate: who actually does the best Sunday lunch?

content.text: The Sunday roast is a British institution. It's not just a meal‚Äîit's a ritual, a tradition, and for many families, the highlight of the week. In Waterlooville, where we have over a dozen pubs and restaurants serving Sunday lunch, the question becomes: which one is actually worth your time and money?

We spent four Sundays (and one very uncomfortable Monday morning) eating our way through Waterlooville's Sunday roast offerings. We judged on meat quality, roast potatoes, Yorkshire puddings, vegetables, gravy, value for money, and that indefinable 'would we come back?' factor.
The Criteria

A great Sunday roast needs certain elements: meat that's properly rested and carved, roast potatoes with actual crunch, Yorkshire puddings that stand proud (not sad, soggy affairs), vegetables that aren't boiled to death, and gravy that's rich without being salty. Bonus points for generous portions and not charging extra for an extra Yorkshire.
What We Found

Quality varied wildly. Some places are clearly reheating frozen Yorkshires (you can tell‚Äîthey go weirdly chewy). Others are putting genuine love and attention into every element. Price didn't always correlate with quality either‚Äîwe had a ¬£12 roast that was excellent and a ¬£18 one that was mediocre.

üçΩÔ∏è **Booking Essential:** The best Sunday roasts in Waterlooville get booked up by Wednesday. If you're planning to just turn up at 1pm on Sunday, bring a good book because you'll be waiting a while.
The Verdict

Without naming names (you'll have to visit to find your favourite), the best roasts shared these traits: they sourced meat locally, made everything from scratch, didn't try to be fancy (no 'deconstructed' nonsense), and they understood that generous portions matter.
The worst? Pre-made everything, stingy portions, and that cardinal sin‚Äîcharging ¬£2 extra for an additional Yorkshire pudding. It's flour, eggs, and milk. Come on.
